thread.title: Attraction World offers agents Rolling Stones Satisfaction
thread.title_full: Attraction World offers agents Rolling Stones Satisfaction

title: Attraction World offers agents Rolling Stones Satisfaction
text:
Attraction World offers agents Rolling Stones Satisfaction 6 July 2015 Save 
Attraction World is offering agents the satisfaction of selling tickets for The Rolling Stones exhibition next year. 
The tickets, which go on sale on July 10, will also be available via Encore Tickets’ groups departments. 
The tickets are for the Exhibitionism show which opens at The Saatchi Gallery on April 6 and charts the band’s history since the its formation in the 1960s. 
The immersive show will be spread across nine galleries and two floors of the venue with more than 500 previously unseen artefacts and images. 
The show has been created with the band’s backing. Mick Jagger said: “We’ve been thinking about it for quite a long time but wanted it to be just right and on a large scale just like planning our touring concert productions. I think right now, it’s an interesting time to do it.” 
Keith Richards added: “While this is about The Rolling Stones, it’s not necessarily just about the members of the band. 
“It’s also about all the paraphernalia and technology associated with a band like us, as well as the instruments that have passed through our hands over the years that will make the exhibition really interesting.”
